title: Welcome
text:
I am an Assistant Professor of Instruction at the Department of Political Science at Northwestern University. I teach courses on statistics, statistical computing, and computational social science.
My research develops standards to navigate research design tradeoffs in the social sciences, with focus on causal inference and computational social science. My substantive work applies these ideas to questions in comparative politics and political behavior.
I received my PhD from the Department of Political Science at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

text:

Thanks for visiting! You can find resources related to my talk here. Feel free to reach out if you have any comments or questions.
You can also use the navigation bar to learn more about me and my work.
